intro: Smithia strigosa, commonly known as the hairy smithia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. Smithia strigosa produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color.
